english: to surround; to encircle; to besiege; enclosure

etymology.description: semantic: 囗 (“enclosure”) + phonetic: 韋 (simplified as 韦).
etymology.interpretation: 囗 conveys the idea of enclosing or surrounding, while 韋 supplies the sound wéi and was the original graph for this word. In simplification, 韋 was streamlined to 韦, preserving the pronunciation and core meaning.
etymology.simplification: Phonetic component simplified (韋 → 韦) to reduce strokes, while the enclosure 囗 remained unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我们把敌人团团围住(我們把敵人團團圍住)。
examples.english: We surrounded the enemy on all sides.

examples.chinese: 城市被洪水围成一片孤岛(城市被洪水圍成一片孤島)。
examples.pinyin: Chéngshì bèi hóngshuǐ wéi chéng yī piàn gūdǎo.
examples.english: The city was encircled by floodwaters and became an island.

examples.chinese: 村民在田地周围修围墙(村民在田地周圍修圍牆)。
examples.pinyin: Cūnmín zài tiándì zhōuwéi xiū wéiqiáng.
examples.english: Villagers built an enclosing wall around the fields.
